title: Reg Watson, ‘Godfather of the modern soap’ who created ‘Crossroads’ and the smash hit Australian suburban drama ‘Neighbours’ – obituary
text:
Reg Watson, who has died aged 93, was a pioneering Australian-born television scriptwriter and producer once described as the “godfather of the modern soap”.

He created the ITV Midland motel-based saga Crossroads and went on to introduce the world to Neighbours, set in Ramsay Street, a cul-de-sac in a Melbourne suburb, that went on to become one of Australia’s most successful media exports, achieving huge popularity particularly among BBC audiences in the late 1980s and 1990s.
